thread.title: Catholic Charities is opening a temporarily warming center - News8000.com - WKBT
thread.title_full: Catholic Charities is opening a temporarily warming center - News8000.com - WKBT

author: Shaquille Davis
title: Catholic Charities is opening a temporarily warming center - News8000.com - WKBT
text: LA CROSSE (WKBT) -- As the temperature starts to go below zero, the city of La Crosse is opening an emergency day shelter to keep the less fortunate warm. The shelter will only be open from Jan. 14 - 15 for a set time. LA CROSSE (WKBT) -- As the temperature starts to go below zero, the city of La Crosse is opening an emergency day shelter to keep the less fortunate warm. The shelter will only be open from Jan. 14 - 15 for a set time. For both days it will be open from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. and is located at 621 3rd Street North. Another shelter will be opening its doors and providing transportation from the La Crosse emergency shelter. The Catholic Charities will be opening its warming center to anyone who needs shelter during these frigid conditions. "What we're doing is basically folks that need a place to go during the day they can go to that shelter," explains Director of the Catholic Charities Warming Center Rob Grover. "And then in the even hours, our shelter open up about 6:30 p.m. people can start coming and then you can spend the night there all the way til 8 a.m. the next day" Grover also says they are looking for volunteers and donations to help keep the shelter up and running. If you'd like to donate or volunteer, [here](https://cclse.org/) is the link to their website. COPYRIGHT 2024 BY NEWS 8 NOW/NEWS 8000. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
